V-zpBMG0Y9SO_prz0gfNHw.text: My wife and I stumbled upon this place after a long day of sightseeing, and decided to eat there mostly because it was nearby.  We were a little worried when we walked in on a Friday night and it was mostly empty, but we were soon put at ease.The food was great - well-prepared and very flavorful. The service was fine - they actually seemed over-staffed.  The atmosphere was quaint and classy - we nearly forgot about the busy street we'd walked in from.  The prices were very reasonable - considering the quality of the food, I'd say we got more than our money's worth.All in all, it was a really nice meal to top off a great day. Recommended!

Fz3LuSxC6Kb-dSAvnFAkPg.text: Decent pizza. The meat stuffed ravioli was disgusting!! Especially after the waiter mentioned how they use only fresh ingredients!! I could not even eat it!

qngeSfXemubqqzYTeuU4yA.text: I don't write a lot of reviews, but this spot was a gem worth discussing. The food was amazing. I had the special chicken and prosciutto with spicy penne. The chicken was delicious and perfectly cooked. The pasta was simply perfect. A little kick with perfectly cooked pasta. I'd definitely recommend checking this place any whenever you're in London

M4di_VVwQIyPM1pDB31LjQ.text: Highly recommended - and great value for money!We went to Il Posto before going to see "Wicked" across the road at The Apollo (Victoria).  We were all running a little late, and didn't get into the restaurant until 6.30pm (the show was at 7.30pm).  We were greeted with smiles and well wishes from about 4 or 5 staff as we walked past, and shown to our table. We mentioned that we were seeing the show at 7.30pm - the waiter assured us that he'd ensure that we ate/drank/paid and left in time for the show.He wasn't wrong! We had such great service, there was no lag at all.  We even had time for starters (bruschetta - yum!) as well as mains.  And the food was so great, and HUGE! I had the canneloni (delicious, and supremely cheesy!), my husband the calzone and our friend had the gnocci. All were amazing, and huge portions.  The total bill including a (fairly modest, to be honest) included service charge was under £50, and that included a bottle of wine, too.  For great friendly service and good quality food you can't go wrong.

kn-kuoabLdX3K14HWxDlow.text: Amazing, amazing, amazing food!  The owner, Luka, came over, sat down with us and helped us each select our dish for the evening.  He even created something "off the menu" for my friend.  The lasagna and the pizza was to die for.  I honestly wanted to eat there every night on my 9-day vacation because I simply didn't want to try new places and be disappointed, because I couldn't imagine anyone matching up to the quality of food at this place... and no one did!  Great job, Luka, and great job Il Posto!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom

bcqvskFRwjG2BnKVb8z5bA.text: A very very favourite place of mine. Myself and my family have been going for years and the owners are now great friends. The food and the wine is 'perfecto' the waiters are just fabulous and are always happy to help! Great atmosphere and a great night out!! Always go away feeling fall and slightly tipsy!

rl6WytbpJW-ftVolgL55Sg.text: Great traditional Italian food. Very quaint atmosphere with great friendly and helpful service. Would recommend to anyone, and would happily come again!

bpqPh8DC_4tBQi12znsnPg.text: It seems to be a stop over for the theatre for people out of town. The food just didn't seem very fresh-- I think the mushrooms came from a can.

ucCml3aPKp0mFJFT-yT3ZQ.text: Fantastic Italian food at a great price! The owners are the real deal. I am an American who has been there a half-dozen times and the remember me every time. Tonight's garlic prawns were incredible. I was full on the bread soaked in the garlic butter sauce from the starter!

0aNmEoof8ZTDd8OF2y3mKQ.text: Great value and great food in London area.  Right across from the Appollo theater.  Friendly staff and great owner, Luca.  Price is comparable to California after conversion.  Better value than most Italian places in the Bay Area.  Awesome Risotto and pizza bread.

2P0hivBrJXI5EtAu9DYCnA.text: We picked this spot for a pre-show dinner as it's right across the road from the theatre.We shared the carpaccio starter to begin our meal and it was very good. My friend had a pizza and I picked the spaghetti carbonara. The portion sizes were quite large and the food tasted decent, though it was nothing special. Dessert was delicious though! So don't skip on that! Service was a bit slow and there was no dedicated server for specific tables, so things got confusing once in a while. While the staff were all quite friendly, this disorganised approach did bother me a bit. The tables are also placed so closely together that we were practically sitting on other people's laps, so don't expect huge comfort.It's still a nice restaurant and I'd probably return here next time I go to see Wicked!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Delicious semifreddo!
Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom

VhRfI6r8Tkrf4lEU0-HBqw.text: Great food, ridiculously uncomfortable dining experience. Not sure if it was the luck of the draw, or the fact we came at the same time as several holiday parties, but I found myself crammed like a sardine into a small table where I was constantly being bumped by the waiters as they served other tables.Speaking of waiters, our own special person was one of the most surly people I encountered during our trip. He did, however, recommend the Pappardelle con Nastrini di Pollo, or chicken ribbons with roasted peppers, courgette & fresh tomatoes. This dish was excellent, as was the calamari appetizer. Too bad my dining experience was hampered by the service and seating.

8v-uXq4qH3rQh-pOFqdE5A.text: Amazing food and service! We ate here just before attending Wicked across the street. They knew we were in a time crunch, got us in very quickly, let us order while we were waiting, and ate with time to spare to get to our show!  I had the meat stuffed ravioli with a nice smooth red sauce. My husband had the spaghetti with meat sauce which was very flavorful almost spicy. We loved the food and appreciated the great service!

_nQrxCl4BvaDmdBj84vHfw.text: Great authentic Italian restaurant. First time visiting London and was glad to have stopped by this venue. We tried the calamari fritti. It was tasty, served warm with great dipping sauces, next course tried pasta Bolognese which was full flavors. Last was the veal scaloppini dish which was nothing less than perfection. Although very busy (Friday night), the food came out nice and hot. Very clean, lots of attention to detail and best of all GREAT STAFF! I will be sure to recommend this place to anyone seeking authentic Italian in the Victoria district of London.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Loved the sauces. Lightly seared just right.
Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Full of flavor!

-4eQV-4rX2sIfB-AO01KFg.text: Wish we'd discovered this restaurant earlier in our trip to London. We were desperately tired of pub food. 4 stats for food. Unfortunately, VERY noisy. Don't count on carrying out normal conversation.

0R9I65I6_F2gDsTqQUeSIw.text: Loved this restaurant.  Looking for something different from pub food and found a little slice of Italy near Victoria station.  Prices were great.  Good simple, delicious Italian favorites.  We had calamari, garlic bread and spaghetti bolognese.  There were much fancier options, but we wanted something simple.  Wait staff was awesome.  My daughter spilled her water and was embarrassed and they were so kind to her.  Prompt friendly service.  Like being back in Italy for a few hours!

tAKA-vg--JtdkXANi2_prw.text: Great Italian restaurant not too far from Victoria. We had dinner here after visiting the National Portrait Gallery. Italian dishes were way more delicious and at the same time slightly cheaper compared to similar Italian restaurants in US.We had the seafood spaghetti which was awesome, the pasta was perfectly cooked. The gnocchi was great too. The ambience was great and slightly formal. Not the best place to take small kids because the restaurant is relatively quiet, though we managed. Definitely worth a try.Thanks for making our first ever meal in London worthwhile!!

5-cj_ObAzstQgqOOcejzqw.text: Fantastic! What a little (almost) hidden gem. We stumbled upon this place while staying at the Grosvenor. We would we return again!

GBVT6sRIjsSetw7lPh8GCQ.text: Very good pizza served quite quickly! Really liked it! A bit to many people in a small space to my taste, but that's just me (plus it was a Saturday evening so yeah :) )They ask for 10% tip. The service was good so we happily paid it.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Giardiniera for me and pasta carbonara for my friend!

3WRP7iK6TCmwlMin4u-oEQ.text: This place is amazing!! My friend and I came here prior to attending Wicked right across the street. We made reservations and good thing because they were pretty busy even when we got there shortly after 5:30pm (show was at 7:30pm so we wanted plenty of time for dinner and drinks). We were greeted and seated right away, then one server comes to get our drink order. Promptly they bring it to us and then take our order. Food was nothing short of wonderful! We ordered the bruschetta and caprese salad as appetizers then we each ordered the gnocchi as our meals (both obsessed with it obviously!). And of course we had to try dessert...Strawberry cheesecake. However I think it was more of a pastry type than a cheesecake but regardless it was delicious! The owners were so friendly and checked in on us regularly to make sure everything was up to par. All the staff were fabulous as well. I would definitely return here!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Bruschetta and caprese salad
Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Strawberry dessert
Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Gnocchi

t0d1f5RRdUiSb_vHjbybdQ.text: Think their business is all about the theater crowd.  Good was average, service was average.  Does get very crowded regardless of time!

YZSVzgwDL5Q6BDFsM2LeTg.text: We are from the NYC area, so Italian food is comfort food for us. This place was great. Homey, delicious and reasonably priced. It looks small from the street but is actually quite large. It is very deep. It is near theatres so it was busy at pre-theatre dinner time.

692oonjO9Err_slH1FblWA.text: I'm from New York so trust me, the Italian food here was delicious!  The owners went out of their way to make sure we were pleased and made us feel very welcome. They even gave us a restaurant tip for back home. I highly recommend a stop here for a great meal.

2dfnEYxRjxqw1BVzHl28pg.text: Terrible service from this one old guy. He's incredibly rude and yelled at us for no reason. Very pretentious place, basically a glorified Olive Garden.

CnS9v6UolqsNdRcuiMW3Gg.text: I ate a nice dinner here this evening. This is a small, casual, authentic Italian restaurant.  I was able to get a seat without a reservation, but the restaurant was nearly full when I sat down at 6:30 pm.  I had the exact same meal I did about eight months ago. I started off with the bruschetta, which was fantastic.  I had cannelloni for the main course.  It came out hot and was delicious.  I finished up with Tartufur (sp?) Classico for dessert.  This is a ball of chocolate and vanilla ice cream covered in what I believe was cocoa and cinnamon.  It was very good, but could have been improved with a little more chocolate syrup on the plate.  The total bill including a Pimms and tip came to GBP 27.  The individual pizzas seemed to be popular.  Several people around me got them and finished them off completely, although I thought they were large enough for two.

w-63TZ-lsalvq7h8lD1Hhw.text: What a lovely place!  Family run and very welcoming--staff was amazing.  Food was so wonderfully prepared--raviolis were excellent, tagliatelle caminari was big hit and cod delicious.  Profiteroles were also outstanding and lovely coffee to top it off.  Would treck across town next time I come here for a meal.

4C3sT7P_-0lCvF6oLAwVLA.text: Met an old friend for lunch today and chose this restaurant because of its location near Victoria station. Staff were friendly and menu choice was good and the prices reasonable. I had a delicious cheese omelette and was envious of my friends's spaghetti di frutta de mare. Think I''ll choose that next time! Will definitely be back.

80xJho7Gl7k95mnKJDzilw.text: A friend and I ate here as it was based so close to Victoria and it's Yelp reviews were highly rated.The food and ambience is good, service is very good and prices and reasonable. We both had pizza which I wouldn't say is the forte of this place. Wish I had had pasta.I wouldn't say this place rates 5 stars, really between 3 and 4 stars but there is absolutely nothing wrong with that - for what it is, I will certainly come again.

6NjoqdZwrc0sJQxF2wYfKA.text: My daughter and I are visiting from the U.S. and thought we'd try this out.  It had friendly service and good food.  My daughter had the pizza margherita and I had the veal piccata with Marsala sauce and roasted potatoes.  The veal was tender and sauce had a nice flavor.  The restaurant's small interior made for a tight serving space and tables being very close together, but it was not overly uncomfortable, just not optimal.  It certainly isn't fine dining, but appears to be a solid local favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom

qWb2jMW_lIVLeckDHusipw.text: Il Posto is an intimate Italian restaurant off the beaten path by Victoria.  Don't be fooled by the less than mediocre ambiance; the fresh, homemade pasta and adorable Italian waiters easily satisfy all customers.  The service is outstanding and the prices are more than fair.  I highly recommend it if you're feeling ravenous in the Victoria area.

v96vetGwFmEePARB3fv-kg.text: Great place to have dinner before the theater. Fast, friendly service. Delicious food. They were able to get me in and out in under an hour so that I had time to get to the theater before the show.I had a glass of the house white wine (sauvignon blanc) and one of the house special pastas: angel hair pasta with bacon, artichokes and mushrooms in a white wine sauce. It was delicious! Dinner, a glass of wine and a cup of after dinner tea/coffee was around USD$30. I would definitely return for a pre-theater dinner.

Ysc5E3Wpqup6OMwMjE8nug.text: Everything in this restaurant is authentic - from the food to the wait staff we felt like we were transported from London to somewhere in Italy. The only negative thing about this place is you are packed in like sardines but everything else is a 5 star.What we had:Starters: Calamari - not the overly fried we are use to, but they were tender and freshProsciutto with melon - I actually never had this combo before but it was lovelyPastas:Linguine with Prawns in spicy Fra Diavolo sauce - yummy with a kick!Traditional spaghetti with bolognese - yum!Meats:Pollo alla Principessa - chicken with sauce and asparagus - my son says it taste like Morton's Chicken Christopher but betterPollo alla Parmigiana - traditional chicken parm - delicious We had such a great meal I came back the next day and tried the Pappardelle con Nastrini di Pollo - chicken sautéed in red bell peppers, zucchini and garlic. So simple but so good! Just remember when you ask for a table of two don't "peace sign"  the other way!

13hH4nPV4IgaXhacjliyYQ.text: Came here after seeing Hamilton as it's a block away from the the theatre. Quick service and pretty good food-we got some pastas. The owners seem really invested in keeping their customers content, which is always nice.

xgT5X78PPYN8rhheqltbTg.text: I really enjoyed this place! I found it on Yelp and was not disappointed! I came with a group of 7 and we were seated immediately. The waitstaff were extremely friendly and every person in the group cleaned their plates... Don't hesitate to stop in if you're in the mood for Italian!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Bruschetta

ExOkSV6GlARTNUvfFR5fhw.text: We were desperate for something to eat after attending a concert in Brixton and this was on our way to our flat. We arrived 30 minutes prior to closing and they welcomed us with open arms, even at the late hour. We were seated immediately and welcomed with drinks. I don't like mushrooms but LOVE gnocchi and the sweet waiter said I could have whatever my heart desired because the menu is simply a suggestion or starting point for dishes. I ordered gnocchi without mushrooms and my niece got the tortellini. Both were at our table within 15 minutes and topped with fresh parm. The pasta was fresh and tender and had amazing flavor although a little under salted. It would've been great to have some bread to sop up the sauce but other than that, it was excellent. The portion was on the small side but so was the price. We ordered tiramisu and the dessert of the day (profiteroles) to take away and it was fabulous!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Tortellini with spinach and cheese
Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Gnocchi (without mushrooms)

OnaHPzOFynNcu6XLJms6TQ.text: A charming and delicious Italian restaurant in a wonderful location.We were heading out to see Wicked at the nearby Apollo. Victoria theatre and knew we wanted to find somewhere close by to grab some dinner before the show. We settled on Il Posto because it was so close to the theatre. Upon walking in the door we were pleasantly greeted and wished away to a table near the back. Our waiter was so genuine and joked around with us before taking our orders. We ordered a shrimp dish and bruschetta as our starters. The next thing we knew they were out and we were loving them. The bruschetta was fresh and the shrimp was perfectly cooked with some serious but wonderful spice.We ordered our entrees, I got one of the specials, a mushroom ravioli. Others in the party ordered the cannelloni and a lasagna. My meal was extraordinary. Wonderful freshly made pasta with delicious cheese and mushrooms. If you are looking for a solid Italian meal for a decent price come to Il Posto. They are ready and waiting with a smile and delicious plate of pasta.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Creme Caramel
Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Tiramisu
Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom

h6YcjPPWV8OS_hU8yzi-yA.text: Terrible service. We stopped in for cocktails and appetizers before going to the Apollo Theater across the street.  We explained that we were on a time limit so would only be ordering a few things to share to which the maitre de said would be no problem.  The waiter obviously felt otherwise.  He was truly belligerent and clearly upset that we were not ordering entrees for everyone in our group.  Tho' the encounter was (fortunately) brief with this grumpy, miserable man, other people in my party were physically shaken by his abrasive, judgemental and opinionated attitude.  In addition, the food was not great and pricey for the quality.  Definitely not worth the scolding we took prior.  To be fair, the maitre de and cocktail waitress were very nice.The experience dampened our entire evening as the excitement for dinner and show was quickly ruined.

o3lnmF0wgWQbijHd_1Bhxw.text: Back in 2015 when I first came to London, my cousin's friend recommended this restaurant for reasonable priced Italian food that tasted good. They live in London so the reco was a local one. They were spot on with this reco. Pasta cost between £8-14 and tasted delicious! The serving size is very generous as well. The staff always make you feel like a regular, going above and beyond to make sure you're comfortable. This is my second trip to London and I've come to Il Posto twice! Each time I've tried a different dish. If it were just me, I'd come here for lunch and dinner every day of my trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Calamari
Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Garlic bread
Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Smoked salmon fettuccine

L_uRjAHY4Zh8CP6DrtlpSg.text: The food was so-so, and the staff was rude to my African American friend.Would not go back if I lived in London.It was close to Wicked which we had tickets for.

APS8XWazhk7Zb3updWTJyg.text: Excuisite Italian food. Service is top notch and friendly. There are a few items on the menu marked vegetarian, though they can modify any meal to fit your needs. Portions are not large, allowing for plenty of appetizers and desserts to taste.

V7ah07wqAsXyS-fv0yJ2SA.text: We came in because it was across from the theater and ended up having a fabulous meal. They were able to get us served just in time to make the show. I had the special of the day mushroom ravioli which was excellent. My friends ordered the tortellini, mozzarella and tomato salad and the salmon. We also split a dessert which was delicious. Bread was served with the meal. The staff were very friendly, recommend as a great Italian option.

tETsYvJk418tGYWH596ZMQ.text: So amazing!  Had no idea what we were in for with two picky teenage daughters.  Amazing food!  The wine was amazingly inexpensive and yummy. We ordered a bottle of the monthly special. Yum! I wasn't sure what I wanted but know I wanted shrimp and pasta with spice. The waiter said 'I'll make you something special'... and it was amazing!  Perfect dinner!  Come after 7 after the theater traffic and you can get lots of attention!  Xoxo

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom

F_M0gH_dXEtAnV8GsZlkpg.text: This place is fine for a very standard Italian meal, but this is not a destination for my husband and me. We both had pizzas, which were good but not great. Staff was friendly.

4Dpgo9aoUnLSD20Yv2m8vA.text: Il Posto is a great family owned, unique (to the area) Italian restaurant. The food was delicious and the atmosphere welcoming. My wife and I ate here before seeing a show just across the street at the Apollo Victoria Theatre and we were not disappointed! The owner even sat down with us, asked us how we liked the food and chatted with us for several minutes. We would definitely return.

JpEL7rsjgZfri8glOn8urw.text: We were looking for a nice dinner to eat before watching Wicked when we stumbled upon this restaurant.Our first impression wasn't too great. Upon entry, we were greeted by a grumbly waiter who seemed annoyed that we didn't have a reservation. This was fine, but I feel as though the situation could have been handled differently. They still served us, but throughout the meal, the pretentious attitude of the staff made us feel uncomfortable and unwelcome.The venue was nice looking, although quite small. The staff oftentimes had to squeeze through impossibly small gaps between tables and chairs. At the table next to us, a waiter moved a table while a family was sitting there, which I found quite unusual.The food was nothing to write home about. It was reasonably portioned, enough but not gluttonous. The flavors were what you would expect from pasta, nothing spectacular, nothing bad. The prices were reasonable.Next time I'm looking for a pre show dinner I think I will try elsewhere.

TJChnQ9_Q5fYpjJEQd7EFg.text: Was looking for a quick take away meal after the show. These guys were super quick and the pizza was awesome. Ordered the Margarita. Thin but slightly chewy crust. Being from the US, this reminded me of NY pizza.  Very reasonably priced. Owner was very friendly. Would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom

gW8UKIAn8N3mRdpKzetdhg.text: Excellent service. Punctual in time for Wicked peformance. Conveniently located right across the street from the Apollo Victoria theater.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Tiramisu
Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate mousse- perfect for chocolate lovers!
Photo of Il Posto - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate filled pastry (special of the night)

7gP97PcctIsTrZ70O7C_AA.text: The most amazing pasta. Extremely quick service. Perfect for a pre show bite to eat !!!! Delighted

d76yrc8EYneDFdwiqpZQeQ.text: Go somewhere else.Bad service. They sat us right next to the bathroom door, when there are other seats. There is one waiter, dark hair, maybe italian, with glasses was extremely strange and rude, he almost seemed like he was drunk. He pretty much dropped our dishes on the table, knocked off our fork to the ground, and kicked it across the restaurant, no apologies whatsoever-Garlic bread is 3 small pieces of stale nub ends and costs about 4-5 USD. Pasta is big portioned but mediocre, clams were smallest I've ever seen.

ATiIPTN68rq_0gK0v-kg5Q.text: Tourist trap!!! Stay away!!! My nephew recently cooked somthing that was better than what I ate here. He's 5 years old and it was a dish based on cheerios and bananas. But it was still better than the excuse I had for the Minestrone soup and the Spaghetti fruti di mare I had here. I think the sauce was in fact kethcup and the Spaghetti was cooked some days back. The soup water with black pepper and chopped celery. I didn't return the dishes because I was afraid that they'll trt to force feed me one of their other dishes. The waiters are nice though!
